scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: This subseries includes materials which could be identified as related to Heschel's writings. The types of writings includes tributes, typescripts (in a variety of working draft states) of articles and essays some of which were ultimately published and some presumably unpublished, newspaper articles, editorials, book reviews, galley proofs, and typescripts of interviews with Heschel. Also included are a small amount of handwritten notes, lists and correspondence that are specific to Heschel's writings and materials which are not related to Heschel's writings but were included in the folder. Note that not all typescripts include a title or author name, but were identified as Heschel's based largely on his handwritten corrections or annotations on the typescripts. The materials are arranged chronologically.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Language(s): All materials in German.

Mix of materials including form letters from Erich Reiss Verlag to various editors promoting Die Prophetie, calendars from 1936 and 1937, and a 2 page galley proof from Heschel's Das Prophetische Bewusstsein. Also contains a large amount of clippings written by Heschel including editorials, book reviews, and memoriam.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Language(s): All materials in German.

Also includes pamphlets on lectures offered at the Institute for Jewish Learning in London which were mailed to Heschel and a bulletin from the Theodor Herzl Society.

scopecontent.p: Unmarked galley proof of Heschel's contribution to Reinhold Niebuhr: His Religious, Social, and Political Thought.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Annotated proof sheets with inserted typescript pages of "The Religious Message."

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Language(s): Some materials in German.

Includes corrected typescript, "The Nature of Faith" by Abraham Heschel, a handwritten manuscript "The Hasidic Concept of בין אדם לחבורו [Bein Adam Le'Chavero]. Also includes handwritten notes in German on the topic of Dimension.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Language(s): A few materials in Hebrew.

Mix of materials including Heschel's typed address from the National Women's League of the United Synagogue of America convention, a review of a book by Will Herberg, correspondence related to some of Heschel's books, and clippings related to Heschel's talk in Argentinia and an article by Heschel in דרום entitled היחיד הדורנו

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: A poem, "Is Now," by Mark Van Doren and an article from The Zionist Quarterly, "To Be A Jew: What Is It?" by Heschel.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Language(s): A few materials in Hebrew.

A mix of handwritten notes and typescripts. Contains conference material for "An Ecumenical Witness" Conference which includes "The Reason for My Involvement in the Peace Movement" by Heschel. Includes galley proofs of an article Heschel wrote for ha-Doʼar, בעיית היהדות בדורנו, [The Problem of Judaism in our Generation] and a handwritten list of publications. Also contains the Spring 1972 issue of the United Synagogue Review which includes a number of letters to the editor regarding an article Heschel wrote in a previous issue.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Contains outline by Heschel for possible article on theology at the end of the First Temple; an article titled 'Between Science and Faith;" and other notes.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Contains two typescripts, "The Mystical Element in Judaism: The Exaltation of Man" by Heschel and an "Introduction Between God and Man" by F.A. Rothschild.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Corrected typescript drafts, fragments, photocopied typescripts, and some correspondence on a variety of topics including ambition, human rights, Soviet Jewry, human nature, man as a symbol of God, and Judaism. Also includes article written by Heschel in The Torch, "Should the United Synagogue of America Join The World Zionist Organization? No says: Abraham Joshua Heschel."

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Language(s): Some materials in Hebrew and Yiddish.

A mix of publications and clippings. Includes a copy of a Yiddish poem on auto-da-fé, "The Pathos of Liberal Theology" by Van A. Harvey reprinted from the Journal of Religion, and an essay, הערות, by Heschel removed from an unknown publication.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Language(s): All materials in German.
Photocopy of authors contract for "Das Gebet als Äusserung und Einfühlung" of the Monatschrift, Volume 83.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Transliteration: Ḳosov
Translation: [Rabbi Nachman from] Kosov
Language(s): All materials in Hebrew.
Contains a letter about Rabbi Nachman from Kosov, a copy of Heschel's article about him, and a mixture of typescripts and handwritten notes (presumably in preparation of the article).

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Transliteration: Shonot, lo ḥashuv
Translation: Miscellaneous, Not Important?
Language(s): Some materials in Hebrew.

Primarily handwritten notes, but also includes clippings and typescript fragments related to a variety of theological and philosophical themes including value, absurdity, faith, and image of self. Also includes typescript "Quest for Exaltation: Blessing or Curse?" written by Heschel.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Primarily handwritten notes related to a variety of topics including Judaism, Israel, and reverence. Also includes a letter with two draft copies of "The Dilemma of the Space Age" which was prepared from a recorded interview with Heschel in 1963.

did.unittitle: Quotations from Heschel made by others and references to him

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Mix of clippings, articles, and editorials either quoting Heschel or written by Heschel.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Primarily typescripts of articles and addresses by Heschel. Includes Heschel's address at the New York Conference on Soviet Jewry; "What Happens" (Heschel makes reference to Civil Rights and the Jews of Soviet Russia); "The Study of Torah"; "Soul Threatening Situations: from the Kiln of Jewish Existence" translated by Aryeh Cohen; "Chosen People: not a title but a yoke" (in Ma'ariv) translated by Samuel Dresner; "One the Day of Hate", a poem translated by Leonard Wolf; and typed notes on talk of Rabbi J.B. Soloveitchik. Also includes a letter related to the establishment of the Abraham Joshua Heschel Center for Nature Studies.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: A mix of typescripts, publications, handwritten notes and clippings. Includes a number of Heschel essays including "Some Basic Issues of Jewish Religious Education," "The Relevance of Prophecy," and "A Generation that Knows the Testimony but is Powerless to Testify."

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Primarily annotated and corrected typescripts presumably related to Heschel's article "No Religion is an Island." Also includes a handwritten outline for the article.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Transliteration: Ginze Ha-Yesha
Translation: Concealed Deliverance
Language(s): All materials in Hebrew.
Typescript of Heschel's Ginze HaYesha, with published version in ha-Doʼar (August 1967); Heschel's editor's note in Panim al Panim (12 May 1967).

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Consists of two short essays on the 1967 Six-Day War and an original manuscript "Why Israel is Important to Jewish People."

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Contains a corrected manuscript "Eldad and Medad - A Rabbinic Portrait," written by Heschel, with a cover letter from the editor at Harvard Theological Review returning the manuscript.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Primarily typed parables on variety of topics including The Baal Shem Tov, Hasidism, and Mishnah. Also contains two letters from Heschel to Lily and royalty reports for Man's Quest for God.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Primarily typed parables on variety of topics including The Baal Shem Tov, Hasidism, and Mishnah. Also contains two letters from Heschel to Lily and royalty reports for Man's Quest for God.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Primarily incomplete and annotated typescripts of several articles written by Heschel including "What is religious about religious education?", "Needs and Ends", and "Idols in the Temple."

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note

Various manuscripts by and about Abraham Joshua Heschel, including Heschel's article "The Concept of Man in Jewish Thought." Also includes an incomplete manuscript with chapters about Heschel by Maurice Friedman and "Cry Out to Ninevah! Abraham Joshua Heschel on Militarism, Nuclear War, and Conscience", edited by Burt Jacobson.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Primarily annotated typescripts and a Yiddish newspaper clipping related to Zionism, the Torah, and halacha.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Annotated typescripts and a transcripted conversation between a rabbi and "EE" related to The Baal Shem Tov and Hasidism. Also includes a small amount of handwritten notes by Heschel.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Contains two photocopied typescripts; a draft introduction to parables with corrections and annotations and a transcript of an audio interview with Heschel on the topic of stories. In the transcript Heschel also speaks about his grandfather and his childhood in Poland.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Publications by and about Heschel. Includes a photocopy of the article "Halacha and agada" removed from The Jerusalem Post Magazine.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note

Contains several corrected and annotated draft typescripts on Maimonides including sections entitled "The Holy Spirit in the Middle Ages (Until the Time of Maimonides" and "Did Maimonides Believe that He Attained the Rung of Prophecy?" Also includes original and translated versions of two offprints written by Heschel, "Das Wesen der Dinge nach der Lehre Gabirols" (The Essence of Things in Gabirol's Doctrine) and "Der Begriff der Einheit in der Philosophie Gabirols" (The Concept of Unity in Gabirol's Philosophy).

Also includes original and translated versions of two offprints written by Heschel, "Das Wesen der Dinge nach der Lehre Gabirols" (The Essence of Things in Gabirol's Doctrine) and "Der Begriff der Einheit in der Philosophie Gabirols" (The Concept of Unity in Gabirol's Philosophy).

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Contains five typecript essays written by Heschel, all of which are in English and include corrections. Essays include "The Concept of Being in the Philosophy of Ibn Gabirol", "The Concept of Unity in Gabirol's Philosophy", "The Essence of Things in Gabirol's Doctrine", "Prophetic Inspiration in the Middle Ages (Until the time of Maimonides)", and "Did Maimonides Believe that He Attained the Ring of Prophecy?".

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note

Essays include "The Concept of Being in the Philosophy of Ibn Gabirol", "The Concept of Unity in Gabirol's Philosophy", "The Essence of Things in Gabirol's Doctrine", "Prophetic Inspiration in the Middle Ages (Until the time of Maimonides)", and "Did Maimonides Believe that He Attained the Ring of Prophecy?".

Dresner and E. Gendler) and an essay on mitzvot by F. A. Rothschild.

Mix of materials including handwritten notes, typescript "The Patient as a Person", clippings and assorted third-person reviews related to a variety of topics, and Heschel's rebuttal to Marvin Lowenthal's review of The Earth is the Lord's.

A mix of correspondence to Sylvia Heschel, printed and typescript pages, mostly posthumously published speeches, essays and book reviews. Includes a galley proof of an article in Cross Currents entitled "The Meaning of Israel" written by Heschel.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: This subseries contains materials which were clearly written by others or could not easily be identified as being written by Heschel, materials presumably collected and used by Heschel or sent to him for background research or topics of interest to him, and notes clearly not in Heschel's handwriting. Types of writings include articles and publications about Heschel and a variety of other topics, essays, translations of some of Heschel's works, reports, addresses, typescripts, manuscripts, lists, pamphlets, and clippings.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Language(s): All materials in Hebrew.

Photostat of letter sent from the communities in Safed [Tzfat] and Tiberias in 1810/1811 requesting monetary donations from Jewish communities across Europe, signed by group of signatures. Includes handwritten note quoting phrases from document.

Mix of materials related to a variety of topics. Materials include correspondence, review of Torah min HaShamayim, questions presumably from Heschel's talks at Stanford, press releases from Who is Man?, offprint articles and bulletins from a variety of authors including Leo Jung, Shalom Spiegel, Rabbi Menachem M. Schneerson, and Martin Buber (partial copy of Religion und Modernes Denken), clippings, listing of new Hebrew books from Biegeleisen, copy of chapters from R. Shlomo Kluger and "Likutei Omrim", and a typed statement given by Heschel at the Union Theological Seminary.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Magazine and newspaper articles, interviews, and commentaries specifically about Heschel. Includes authors such as Arthur Herzog, Edmond La Beaume Cherbonnier, and Fritz A. Rothschild and magazines such as Newsweek. Also includes magazine America in which most of the magazine is dedicated to Heschel. Authors include Louis Finkelstein, John C. Bennett, and Jacob Neuser.

Contains negative reproductions of handwritten stories about modern Rabbis, all beginning with "shama'ti mi..." ("I have heard from"). Also contains one typescript about the correct way of performing the inauguration of a Sefer Torah. Several of the stories are on letterhead from Rabbi M. Landa.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note

Includes the Spring-Summer 1964 issues of Tradition which includes the article "Dr. A. J. Heschel's Theology of Pathos" by Eliezer Berkovits. Also includes reviews of "Man is Not Alone" in Bitzaron Hebrew Monthly (June-July 1952) and The Humanist (1952). "Man's Question for God" in the Perkins School of Theology Journal (Winter 1955), Congress Weekly (January 24, 1955), the Journal of Bible and Religion (June 1955), the Westminster Bookman (June 1955), The Reconstructionist (December 30, 1955).

German translation of Heschel's article "Towards an Understanding of Halacha" by Curt Rosenthal.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Assorted publications and clippings. Includes an issue of Our Age (March 13, 1966) which includes an interview with Heschel and the Spring 1954 issue of The Torch which includes an article, "A New Teacher and Personality in the Conservative Movement," about Heschel. Also includes pages torn from the January 31, 1966 issue of Newsweek which contains the article "What God Thinks of Man" about Heschel.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Language(s): A few materials in Hebrew.

A mix of publications and handwritten notes. Includes a copy of "The Religious Thought of Abraham Heschel" by Fritz A. Rothschild from Conservative Judaism, the Mid-Jan. 1960 issue of Keeping Posted which includes an article about Heschel, a copy of "Abraham Joshua Heschel's Contributions to Jewish Scholarship" by Rabbi Seymour Siegel, a review of Man's Quest for God by Rabbi Maurice Wohlgelernter from the Jewish Horizon (March 1955), and a review of God in Search of Man by Emil L. Fackenheim from Conservative Judaism (Fall 1960).

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Contains two publications; the first about Heschel being named the Fosdick Professor, the other titled "The Neo-Hasidism of Abraham J. Heschel" by Joseph H. Lookstein.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Articles and pamphlets, with some of the text underlined, primarily related to religion and education.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Language(s): Some materials in Hebrew.

Publications including two 1962 issues of ניב which contain articles about Heschel, "Faith as the Leap of Action: The Theology of Abraham Joshua Heschel" by Jakob J. Petuchowski from Commentary (May 1958), "A. J. Heschel and the Philosophy of the Bible: Mystic or Rationalist?" by E. LaB. Cherbonnier from Commentary, "Liberal Judaism and Contemporary Jewish Thought" by Maurice Friedman from Midstream (Autumn 1959), "God and the Modern Man: The Approach of Abraham J. Heschel by Fritz A. Rothschild from Judaism: A Quarterly Journal of Jewish Life and Thought (Spring 1959), and an offprint of "Abraham Joshua Heschel: Toward a Philosophy of Judaism by Maurice Friedman from Conservative Judaism (Winter 1956).

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Language(s): All materials in French.

Primarily printed publications and reviews of Heschel's published volume Les Bâtisseurs du Temps. Includes a letter from Léon Algazi thanking Heschel for a box of cigars and praising him on the French translation of his book.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Typed essay entitled "Abraham Heschel's Views on Ethics" written by a student for a class not taught by Heschel.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Contains printed publications including the bulletin of The American Academy of Arts and Sciences, American Jewish Archives, and listings of new publications from KTAV Publishing House. Also includes the requirements for the Degree of Doctor of Hebrew Literature from The Jewish Theological Seminary.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Includes a typed letter regarding the education (mainly literary) of Jewish adolescents at a Seminary, and a transcript of a lecture by an unknown person given before the Humanist Society at Brooklyn College.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note

A mix of publications and clipplings. Includes an article about Heschel speaking on the anniversary of the Jewish Public Library in Montreal, the Fall 1960 issue of Tradition: A Journal of Orthodox Thought which contains the article "Heschel, Intuition, and the Halakhah" by Marvin Fox, the Winter 1956 issue of Conservative Judaism which contains the article "Abraham Joshua Heschel: Toward a Philosophy of Judaism" by Maurice Friedman and the January-February 1964 issue of Think which contains the article "A Visit with Rabbi Heschel" by Arthur Herzog. Also includes the pages related to Heschel from איש ושיחו.

Also includes "In a Time of Tragic Conflict," a sermon preached by Dr. Roger L. Shinn of Union Theological Seminary.
